Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a picture showing plants that have enough water and how they look healthy and growing.
The student can draw a picture showing plants without water and how they look wilted or not growing well.
The student can show, through their drawings, the difference in how the plants appear when they either have or do not have water.
The student can include in their drawing a comparison to highlight the need for water in plants' growth.
CANNOT: The student might inconsistently label or forget to label the drawings to show which plant is with water and which is without (*minor oversight in labeling*).
The student might not fully demonstrate the pattern of water being necessary through verbal reasoning alongside their drawings, even if visually represented (*visual but not verbal understanding*).
